00008 
00009 void linear_interp_kick(
00010     const ftype *__restrict beam_dt,
00011     ftype *__restrict beam_dE,
00012     const ftype *__restrict voltage_array,
00013     const ftype *__restrict bin_centers,
00014     const int n_slices,
00015     const int n_macroparticles)
00016 {
00017 
00018     const ftype binFirst = bin_centers[0];
00019     const ftype binLast = bin_centers[n_slices - 1];
00020     const ftype inv_bin_width = (n_slices - 1) / (binLast - binFirst);
00021 
00022     #pragma omp parallel for
00023     for (int i = 0; i < n_macroparticles; ++i) {
00024         const ftype a = beam_dt[i];
00025         const int ffbin = static_cast<int>((a - binFirst) * inv_bin_width);
00026         const ftype voltageKick =
00027             ((a < binFirst) || (a > binLast))
00028             ? 0.0
00029             : voltage_array[ffbin] +
00030             (a - bin_centers[ffbin]) *
00031             (voltage_array[ffbin + 1] - voltage_array[ffbin]) *
00032             inv_bin_width;
00033         beam_dE[i] += voltageKick;
00034     }
00035 }

00037 InducedVoltageTime::InducedVoltageTime(std::vector<Intensity *> &WakeSourceList,
00038                                        time_or_freq TimeOrFreq)
00039 {
00040     // Induced voltage derived from the sum of
00041     // several wake fields (time domain).*
00042     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00043 
00044     // *Wake sources inputed as a list (eg: list of BBResonators objects)*
00045     fWakeSourceList = WakeSourceList;
00046 
00047     // *Time array of the wake in [s]*
00048     fTimeArray = f_vector_t();
00049 
00050     // *Total wake array of all sources in* [:math:`\Omega / s`]
00051     fTotalWake = f_vector_t();
00052 
00053     // *Induced voltage from the sum of the wake sources in [V]*
00054     fInducedVoltage = f_vector_t();
00055 
00056     // Pre-processing the wakes
00057     fTimeArray.resize(Slice->n_slices);
00058     for (uint i = 0; i < fTimeArray.size(); ++i) {
00059         fTimeArray[i] = Slice->bin_centers[i] - Slice->bin_centers[0];
00060     }
00061     sum_wakes(fTimeArray);
00062 
00063     fCut = fTimeArray.size() + Slice->n_slices - 1;
00064     fShape = mymath::next_regular(fCut);
00065 
00066     fTimeOrFreq = TimeOrFreq;
00067 }

00069 InducedVoltageTime::~InducedVoltageTime() { fft::destroy_plans(); }
00070 
00071 inline void InducedVoltageTime::track()
00072 {
00073     auto GP = Context::GP;
00074     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00075     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00076 
00077     // Tracking Method
00078     f_vector_t v = this->induced_voltage_generation();
00079 
00080     std::transform(v.begin(), v.end(), v.begin(),
00081                    std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), GP->charge));
00082 
00083     linear_interp_kick(Beam->dt.data(), Beam->dE.data(), v.data(),
00084                        Slice->bin_centers.data(), Slice->n_slices,
00085                        Beam->n_macroparticles);
00086 }
00087 
00088 void InducedVoltageTime::sum_wakes(f_vector_t &TimeArray)
00089 {
00090     // *Summing all the wake contributions in one total wake.*
00091     fTotalWake.resize(TimeArray.size());
00092     std::fill(fTotalWake.begin(), fTotalWake.end(), 0);
00093     for (Intensity *i : fWakeSourceList) {
00094         i->wake_calc(TimeArray);
00095         std::transform(fTotalWake.begin(), fTotalWake.end(), i->fWake.begin(),
00096                        fTotalWake.begin(), std::plus<ftype>());
00097     }
00098 }

00100 void InducedVoltageTime::reprocess()
00101 {
00102     // *Reprocess the wake contributions with respect to the new_slicing.*
00103     // WARNING As Slice is a global variable,
00104     // users will have to change this variable and call reprocess()
00105 
00106     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00107     fTimeArray.resize(Slice->n_slices);
00108     for (uint i = 0; i < fTimeArray.size(); ++i) {
00109         fTimeArray[i] = Slice->bin_centers[i] - Slice->bin_centers[0];
00110     }
00111     sum_wakes(fTimeArray);
00112 
00113     fCut = fTimeArray.size() + Slice->n_slices - 1;
00114     fShape = mymath::next_regular(fCut);
00115 }

00117 f_vector_t InducedVoltageTime::induced_voltage_generation(uint length)
00118 {
00119 
00120     // Method to calculate the induced voltage from wakes with convolution.*
00121     auto GP = Context::GP;
00122     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00123     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00124     f_vector_t inducedVoltage;
00125 
00126     const ftype factor =
00127         -GP->charge * constant::e * Beam->intensity / Beam->n_macroparticles;
00128 
00129     if (fTimeOrFreq == freq_domain) {
00130         // std::vector<complex_t> fft1, fft2;
00131         // f_vector_t in1 = (Slice->n_macroparticles,
00132         //               Slice->n_macroparticles + Slice->n_slices);
00133         f_vector_t in1(Slice->n_slices);
00134         std::copy(Slice->n_macroparticles.begin(),
00135                   Slice->n_macroparticles.end(), in1.begin());
00136 
00137         f_vector_t in2 = fTotalWake;
00138 
00139         mymath::convolution_with_ffts(in1, in2, inducedVoltage);
00140 
00141         /*
00142         fft::rfft(in, fft1, fShape, n_threads);
00143 
00144         in = fTotalWake;
00145         fft::rfft(in, fft2, fShape, n_threads);
00146 
00147         std::transform(fft1.begin(), fft1.end(), fft2.begin(),
00148                        fft1.begin(), std::multiplies<complex_t>());
00149 
00150         fft::irfft(fft1, inducedVoltage, fShape, n_threads);
00151         */
00152 
00153         std::transform(inducedVoltage.begin(), inducedVoltage.end(),
00154                        inducedVoltage.begin(),
00155                        std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), factor));
00156 
00157     } else if (fTimeOrFreq == time_domain) {
00158         f_vector_t temp(Slice->n_slices);
00159         std::copy(Slice->n_macroparticles.begin(),
00160                   Slice->n_macroparticles.end(), temp.begin());
00161 
00162         inducedVoltage.resize(fTotalWake.size() + temp.size() - 1);
00163 
00164         mymath::convolution(fTotalWake.data(), fTotalWake.size(), temp.data(),
00165                             temp.size(), inducedVoltage.data());
00166 
00167         std::transform(inducedVoltage.begin(), inducedVoltage.end(),
00168                        inducedVoltage.begin(),
00169                        std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), factor));
00170 
00171     } else {
00172         dprintf("Error: Only freq_domain or time_domain are allowed\n");
00173         exit(-1);
00174     }
00175 
00176     inducedVoltage.resize((uint)Slice->n_slices);
00177     fInducedVoltage = inducedVoltage;
00178 
00179     if (length > 0)
00180         inducedVoltage.resize(std::min((uint)Slice->n_slices, length), 0);
00181 
00182     return inducedVoltage;
00183 }

00185 InducedVoltageFreq::InducedVoltageFreq(
00186     std::vector<Intensity *> &impedanceSourceList, ftype freqResolutionInput,
00187     freq_res_option_t freq_res_option, uint NTurnsMem,
00188     bool recalculationImpedance, bool saveIndividualVoltages)
00189 {
00190     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00191 
00192     fNTurnsMem = NTurnsMem;
00193 
00194     fImpedanceSourceList = impedanceSourceList;
00195     fFreqResolutionInput = freqResolutionInput;
00196 
00197     // *Length of one slice.*
00198     auto timeResolution = (Slice->bin_centers[1] - Slice->bin_centers[0]);
00199     fRecalculationImpedance = recalculationImpedance;
00200     fFreqResOption = freq_res_option;
00201 
00202     if (fNTurnsMem == 0) {
00203 
00204         if (fFreqResolutionInput == 0) {
00205             fNFFTSampling = Slice->n_slices;
00206         } else {
00207             int a;
00208             ftype b = 1 / (fFreqResolutionInput * timeResolution);
00209             switch (fFreqResOption) {
00210                 case freq_res_option_t::round_option:
00211                     a = std::round(b);
00212                     break;
00213                 case freq_res_option_t::ceil_option:
00214                     a = std::ceil(b);
00215                     break;
00216                 case freq_res_option_t::floor_option:
00217                     a = std::floor(b);
00218                     break;
00219                 default:
00220                     std::cerr << "The input freq_res_option is not recognized\n";
00221                     exit(-1);
00222                     break;
00223             }
00224             fNFFTSampling = mymath::next_regular(a);
00225 
00226             if (fNFFTSampling < (uint)Slice->n_slices) {
00227                 std::cerr << "The input frequency resolution step is too big, "
00228                           "and the whole\n"
00229                           << "bunch is not sliced... The number of sampling "
00230                           "points for the\n"
00231                           << "FFT is corrected in order to sample the whole "
00232                           "bunch (and\n"
00233                           << "you might consider changing the input in order "
00234                           "to have\n"
00235                           << "a finer resolution\n";
00236                 fNFFTSampling = mymath::next_regular(Slice->n_slices);
00237             }
00238         }
00239 
00240         fFreqResolution = 1 / (fNFFTSampling * timeResolution);
00241 
00242         // self.frequency_array = rfftfreq(self.n_fft_sampling,
00243         // self.slices.bin_centers[1] - self.slices.bin_centers[0])
00244         fFreqArray = fft::rfftfreq(fNFFTSampling, timeResolution);
00245         sum_impedances(fFreqArray);
00246 
00247         fSaveIndividualVoltages = saveIndividualVoltages;
00248         if (fSaveIndividualVoltages) {
00249             // Do I really need to store the length??
00250             uint length = fImpedanceSourceList.size();
00251             fMatrixSaveIndividualImpedances =
00252                 complex_vector_t(length * fFreqArray.size(), 0);
00253             fMatrixSaveIndividualVoltages =
00254                 f_vector_t(length * Slice->n_slices, 0);
00255             for (uint i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
00256                 const uint row_width =
00257                     fImpedanceSourceList[i]->fImpedance.size();
00258                 for (uint j = 0; j < row_width; ++j) {
00259                     fMatrixSaveIndividualImpedances[i * row_width + j] =
00260                         fImpedanceSourceList[i]->fImpedance[j];
00261                 }
00262             }
00263         }
00264 
00265     } else {
00266         fNTurnsMem = NTurnsMem;
00267         fLenArrayMem = (fNTurnsMem + 1) * Slice->n_slices;
00268         fLenArrayMemExt = (fNTurnsMem + 2) * Slice->n_slices;
00269         fNPointsFFT = mymath::next_regular(fLenArrayMemExt);
00270         fFreqArrayMem = fft::rfftfreq(fNPointsFFT, timeResolution);
00271         fTotalImpedanceMem =
00272             complex_vector_t(fFreqArrayMem.size(), complex_t(0, 0));
00273 
00274         fTimeArrayMem.reserve((fNTurnsMem + 1) * Slice->n_slices);
00275         const ftype factor = Slice->edges.back() - Slice->edges.front();
00276 
00277         for (uint i = 0; i < fNTurnsMem + 1; ++i) {
00278             for (uint j = 0; j < (uint)Slice->n_slices; ++j) {
00279                 fTimeArrayMem.push_back(Slice->bin_centers[j] + factor * i);
00280             }
00281         }
00282 
00283         for (const auto &impObj : fImpedanceSourceList) {
00284             impObj->imped_calc(fFreqArrayMem);
00285             std::transform(impObj->fImpedance.begin(), impObj->fImpedance.end(),
00286                            fTotalImpedanceMem.begin(),
00287                            fTotalImpedanceMem.begin(), std::plus<complex_t>());
00288         }
00289     }
00290 }

00294 void InducedVoltageFreq::track()
00295 {
00296     // Tracking Method
00297     auto GP = Context::GP;
00298     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00299     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00300 
00301     induced_voltage_generation();
00302     auto v = fInducedVoltage;
00303     std::transform(v.begin(), v.end(), v.begin(),
00304                    std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), GP->charge));
00305 
00306     linear_interp_kick(Beam->dt.data(), Beam->dE.data(), v.data(),
00307                        Slice->bin_centers.data(), Slice->n_slices,
00308                        Beam->n_macroparticles);
00309 }
00310 
00311 void InducedVoltageFreq::sum_impedances(f_vector_t &freq_array)
00312 {
00313 
00314     fTotalImpedance.resize(freq_array.size());
00315     std::fill(fTotalImpedance.begin(), fTotalImpedance.end(), complex_t(0, 0));
00316     for (auto &i : fImpedanceSourceList) {
00317         i->imped_calc(freq_array);
00318         std::transform(fTotalImpedance.begin(), fTotalImpedance.end(),
00319                        i->fImpedance.begin(), fTotalImpedance.begin(),
00320                        std::plus<complex_t>());
00321     }
00322 }
00323 
00324 void InducedVoltageFreq::reprocess()
00325 {
00326     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00327     auto timeResolution = (Slice->bin_centers[1] - Slice->bin_centers[0]);
00328     if (fFreqResolutionInput == 0) {
00329         fNFFTSampling = Slice->n_slices;
00330     } else {
00331         int a;
00332         ftype b = 1 / (fFreqResolutionInput * timeResolution);
00333         switch (fFreqResOption) {
00334             case freq_res_option_t::round_option:
00335                 a = std::round(b);
00336                 break;
00337             case freq_res_option_t::ceil_option:
00338                 a = std::ceil(b);
00339                 break;
00340             case freq_res_option_t::floor_option:
00341                 a = std::floor(b);
00342                 break;
00343             default:
00344                 std::cerr << "The input freq_res_option is not recognized\n";
00345                 exit(-1);
00346                 break;
00347         }
00348         fNFFTSampling = mymath::next_regular(a);
00349 
00350         if (fNFFTSampling < (uint)Slice->n_slices) {
00351             std::cerr
00352                     << "The input frequency resolution step is too big, and the "
00353                     "whole\n"
00354                     << "bunch is not sliced... The number of sampling points for "
00355                     "the\n"
00356                     << "FFT is corrected in order to sample the whole bunch (and\n"
00357                     << "you might consider changing the input in order to have\n"
00358                     << "a finer resolution\n";
00359             fNFFTSampling = mymath::next_regular(Slice->n_slices);
00360         }
00361     }
00362 
00363     fFreqResolution = 1 / (fNFFTSampling * timeResolution);
00364 
00365     Slice->beam_spectrum_generation(fNFFTSampling, true);
00366     fFreqArray = Slice->fBeamSpectrumFreq;
00367 
00368     fTotalImpedance.clear();
00369     sum_impedances(fFreqArray);
00370 }
00371 
00372 f_vector_t InducedVoltageFreq::induced_voltage_generation(uint length)
00373 {
00374     //    Method to calculate the induced voltage from the inverse FFT of the
00375     //    impedance times the spectrum (fourier convolution).
00376     auto GP = Context::GP;
00377     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00378     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00379 
00380     if (fRecalculationImpedance)
00381         sum_impedances(fFreqArray);
00382 
00383     Slice->beam_spectrum_generation(fNFFTSampling);
00384     // std::cout << "fNFFTSampling : " << fNFFTSampling << "\n";
00385     const auto n = fImpedanceSourceList.size();
00386     const auto factor = -GP->charge * constant::e * Beam->ratio *
00387                         Slice->fBeamSpectrumFreq[1] * 2 *
00388                         (Slice->fBeamSpectrum.size() - 1);
00389 
00390     if (fSaveIndividualVoltages) {
00391 
00392         for (uint i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00393             f_vector_t res;
00394             complex_vector_t in(Slice->fBeamSpectrum.size());
00395 
00396             for (uint j = 0; j < in.size(); ++j) {
00397                 in[j] = fMatrixSaveIndividualImpedances[j * n + i] *
00398                         Slice->fBeamSpectrum[j];
00399             }
00400 
00401             fft::irfft(in, res, 0, Context::n_threads);
00402 
00403             assert(res.size() >= Slice->n_slices);
00404 
00405             res.resize(Slice->n_slices);
00406 
00407             std::transform(res.begin(), res.end(), res.begin(),
00408                            std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), factor));
00409 
00410             for (uint j = 0; j < (uint)Slice->n_slices; ++j) {
00411                 fMatrixSaveIndividualVoltages[j * n + i] = res[j];
00412             }
00413         }
00414 
00415         fInducedVoltage.clear();
00416         fInducedVoltage.resize(Slice->fBeamSpectrum.size());
00417         for (uint i = 0; i < Slice->fBeamSpectrum.size(); ++i) {
00418             ftype sum = 0.0;
00419             for (uint j = 0; j < n; ++j) {
00420                 sum += fMatrixSaveIndividualVoltages[i * n + j];
00421             }
00422             fInducedVoltage[i] = sum;
00423         }
00424 
00425         return f_vector_t();
00426 
00427     } else {
00428         f_vector_t res;
00429         complex_vector_t in(Slice->fBeamSpectrum.size());
00430         for (uint j = 0; j < in.size(); ++j) {
00431             in[j] = fTotalImpedance[j] * Slice->fBeamSpectrum[j];
00432         }
00433 
00434         fft::irfft(in, res, 0, Context::n_threads);
00435         // std::cout << "res size : " << res.size() << std::endl;
00436         // std::cout << "n_slices : " << Slice->n_slices << std::endl;
00437         assert(res.size() >= Slice->n_slices);
00438 
00439         res.resize((uint)Slice->n_slices);
00440 
00441         std::transform(res.begin(), res.end(), res.begin(),
00442                        std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), factor));
00443 
00444         fInducedVoltage = res;
00445 
00446         if (length > 0) {
00447             if (length > res.size())
00448                 res.resize(length, 0);
00449             else
00450                 res.resize(length);
00451         }
00452 
00453         return res;
00454     }
00455 }

00469 void TotalInducedVoltage::track()
00470 {
00471     auto GP = Context::GP;
00472     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00473     auto Slice = Context::Slice;
00474 
00475     this->induced_voltage_sum();
00476     auto v = this->fInducedVoltage;
00477 
00478     std::transform(v.begin(), v.end(), v.begin(),
00479                    std::bind1st(std::multiplies<ftype>(), GP->charge));
00480 
00481     linear_interp_kick(Beam->dt.data(), Beam->dE.data(), v.data(),
00482                        Slice->bin_centers.data(), Slice->n_slices,
00483                        Beam->n_macroparticles);
00484 }

00490 void TotalInducedVoltage::reprocess()
00491 {
00492     for (auto &v : fInducedVoltageList)
00493         v->reprocess();
00494 }
00495 
00496 f_vector_t TotalInducedVoltage::induced_voltage_sum(uint length)
00497 {
00498     // Method to sum all the induced voltages in one single array.
00499     f_vector_t tempIndVolt;
00500     f_vector_t extIndVolt;
00501 
00502     for (auto &v : fInducedVoltageList) {
00503         auto a = v->induced_voltage_generation(length);
00504 
00505         if (length > 0) {
00506             extIndVolt.resize(a.size(), 0);
00507             std::transform(extIndVolt.begin(), extIndVolt.end(), a.begin(),
00508                            extIndVolt.begin(), std::plus<ftype>());
00509         }
00510         tempIndVolt.resize(v->fInducedVoltage.size(), 0);
00511         std::transform(tempIndVolt.begin(), tempIndVolt.end(),
00512                        v->fInducedVoltage.begin(), tempIndVolt.begin(),
00513                        std::plus<ftype>());
00514     }
00515 
00516     fInducedVoltage = tempIndVolt;
00517     return extIndVolt;
00518 }
